alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 26 at 9:29AM CST until January 29 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Sucarnoochee River At Livingston affecting Sumter County. .Flooding continues on the Sucarnoochee River and a flood warning remains in effect. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 1230 AM CST. && ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sucarnoochee River at Livingston. * WHEN...From Sunday morning to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Flooding of farm lands around Livingston occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CST Friday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.0 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
